First, we want to isolate the square root term. To do this, we will subtract 3 from both sides of the equation:

√(8x-2) + 3 - 3 = 7 - 3
√(8x-2) = 4

Now, we want to get rid of the square root. To do this, we will square both sides of the equation:

(√(8x-2))^2 = 4^2
8x - 2 = 16

Next, we want to isolate the x term. We will add 2 to both sides of the equation:

8x - 2 + 2 = 16 + 2
8x = 18

Finally, we will divide both sides of the equation by 8 to solve for x:

8x / 8 = 18 / 8
x = 9/4

So, the solution for x is 9/4 or 2.25.
